snippet: A Florida home for wayward boys was once synonymous with horrific conditions. Now, some are trying to discern what occurred by digging for bodies on the campus’s grounds.
abstract: Forensic anthropologists from University of Southern Florida have spent the last year using sophisticated radar equipment to search grounds of Arthur G Dozier School for Boys in Florida for graves of children who died at school; state's first home for wayward children,  school was synonymous with beatings, abuse, forced labor, neglect and, in some cases, death; search for graves and for causes of death of boys was spurred on by families of victims and scores of former students.
lead_paragraph: A Florida home for wayward boys was once synonymous with horrific conditions. Now, some are trying to discern what occurred by digging for bodies on the campus’s grounds.

headline.seo: At Former Florida Boys’ Home, Looking for Reasons — and Bodies — in the Ground
headline.main: At Boys’ Home, Seeking Graves, and the Reason
headline.print_headline: At Boys’ Home, Seeking Graves, And the Reason

keywords.value: Dozier, Arthur G, School for Boys
